column4: sounds like you're in expert mode, I don't think those warnings should be shown normally
or that this is after a few rounds of errors
ah, yes, you said you were in expert mode. The UI of the expert mode is known to be poor; it's not what people are meant to use normally.
can you ignore those warnings, carry on, and switch to tty2 and find out what it's doing during the 30 seconds when it hangs?
ah, please file a bug on 'linux' with whatever you can transcribe off alt-f2 and alt-f4
use the latter URL
what document gives the preview one?
ah, thanks, I'll fix that
use warty-release-install-i386.iso
fixed, thanks
as I said, it's a kernel bug, please file it
component name is 'linux'
do try to transcribe as much of the error output on alt-f4 as you can
I have tried to describe my problem now.. https://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2773 .. Is that ok?
is it possible to transcribe the text that makes no sense to you?
it may be critical for a developer to figure out where the crash is
that doesn't matter
you can add a comment, use the comment box
I realise it's tedious to copy a crash dump of the screen, but it will probably be necessary here :(
at least from what I can gather from your report, yes
the kernel has fallen over in a messy heap, and the call trace says where it went wrong
I have added the complete call trace: https://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2773
thanks, I'll let Herbert take it from here
